p: The median age of measles cases was 21.0 years (IQR = 26.0 years), subjects who required hospitalization were significantly younger than those reported in the community (median age: 13.0 years vs. 24.5 years; p = 0.044), whereas about half of hospitalized cases (47.8%; n = 77/161) were among adults aged 19 years and older ( Table 1).
